intro: Tritonia strictifolia, commonly known as the rigid leaf tritonia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its erect, strap-like leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in spring and produces clusters of white or pale blue flowers. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Tritonia strictifolia is known for its hardiness and ability to thrive in a variety of garden conditions.
